titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Charles Whitefield Welch (1878-1949) was the Moderator of the General Assembly of the Presbyterian Church in the U.S.A., 1938-1939. He was pastor of the Fourth Avenue Presbyterian Church of Louisville, Kentucky, for 29 years. Welch also served in churches in Tennessee and New York. In 1920-1921 he was Moderator of the Synod of Kentucky and for many years served as chairman of that Synod's Committee on National Missions. He was a director of the Louisville Theological Seminary and of the Presbyterian Theological Seminary in Chicago. He received a Doctor of Theology degree from the Southern Baptist Theological Seminary in Louisville.

scopecontent.p: This is a scrapbook of Welch's year as Moderator of the General Assembly, beginning with his election to Moderator at the 150th General Assembly in Philadelphia in 1938 and documenting his travels throughout the year that followed. Materials include newspaper clippings, itineraries, programs and bulletins, invitations, tickets, postcards, place cards, and photographs.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
